Original Job Description:
Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" p

Resume Content:
﻿Leaficient        Pittsburgh, PA Machine Learning Engineer        Apr 2024 - Present
*  Designed and deployed ML models for image understanding with PyTorch, leveraging vision-language models and image generation to improve segmentation accuracy by 20%. 
* Implemented 3D computer vision models in PyTorch for geometry from monocular images, reducing prediction error by 8%. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, and inference latency to optimize deployment.
* Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
* Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
* Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.


Educative        Lahore, Pakistan Technical Product Manager        Oct 2020 - Dec 2022 
* Led development of ML-powered recommendation and ranking system serving 1.5M+ users, collaborating with engineers to design hybrid algorithms that improved CTR by 10%. 
* Performed A/B testing, offline evaluation, and iterative model refinement to balance recommendation quality with system latency. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.
* Educative Software Engineer        Jun 2018 - Sep 2020 
* Rebuilt backend search & discovery pipeline from basic text-matching to Google’s search infrastructure, enriching results with metadata and improving relevance. Reduced page drop-off by 40%, driving higher content discovery and user retention.

Previous Validation Feedback: Add a targeted summary: 'Product Manager with ML background building applied AI features that drive merchant outcomes; experienced partnering with engineering, data science, and design to ship recommendations and automation at scale.' For Educative (Technical Product Manager), add bullets like: '- Led discovery with X merchants; translated insights into PRD for recommendations feature; launched to Y% of users, improving conversion by Z%.' '- Partnered with DS/ML to design model-driven ranking; defined success metrics and ran A/B test achieving N% lift in GMV.' '- Built 2-quarter roadmap; prioritized backlog across user value, technical feasibility, and business impact.' For Leaficient (Machine Learning Engineer), reframe to product impact: '- Delivered forecasting model powering scheduling automation; reduced manual ops by X% and improved SLA to Y%.' '- Collaborated with PM/design to shape conversational assistant MVP; authored requirements and evaluation plan.' For DHS (Data Scientist Intern): '- Built insights dashboard informing policy decisions; increased adoption by X stakeholders; defined KPIs and iteration plan.' Expand Skills to include Product Management, Roadmapping, Prioritization, User Research, PRD writing, Experimentation/A-B Testing, SQL/Analytics, Generative AI/LLMs (if applicable), Conversational AI, Recommendations, Cross-functional leadership, Communication. Ensure keywords like Applied AI, Generative AI, LLM, Conversational AI, Recommendations, Uber Eats are included where truthful. Standardize formatting (commas between organization and location, consistent date formatting), and keep ATS-friendly with clear section headers and bullet points.

Please create tailored bullet points that highlight relevant experience and skills for this specific role.", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "human", "name": null, "id": null, "example": false}]]

{"job_description": "Product Manager II, Applied AI

San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. [[{"content": "You are the final validator in a multi-agent resume optimization system.

Your role: Validate the complete resume document using requirements from the JD Analyzer.

Critical failure conditions that MUST result in is_valid=false:
- Repetitive or duplicate bullet points (same content repeated)
- Keyword coverage below 60%
- Major grammar/spelling errors
- Missing critical sections (email contact, experience, education)

Evaluate for:
1. Content Quality - NO repetitive bullets, grammar, consistency
2. ATS Compatibility - simple formatting, standard sections
3. Keyword Coverage - using keywords identified by JD Analyzer (consider synonyms and partial matches)
4. Job Alignment - relevance to target position

Only be strict with repetitve content if it is too repetitive or there are exact duplicates.", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "system", "name": null, "id": null}, {"content": "Validate this resume:

RESUME CONTENT:
SHAYAN ALI
shayan.ali.work@gmail.com •  linkedin.com/in/ali-shayan
EDUCATION
Carnegie Mellon UniversityPittsburgh PA
MS in Engineering & Technology Innovation Management	December 2023
Merit Scholarship
Coursework: Machine Learning, Data Science
Lahore University of Management Sciences	Lahore, Pakistan
BS in Computer Science	June 2018
High Merit & Dean's Honor List
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
Leaficient	Pittsburgh, PA
Machine Learning Engineer	Apr 2024 - Present
Department of Human Services	Pittsburgh PA
Data Scientist Intern	Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
Educative	Lahore, Pakistan
Technical Product Manager	Oct 2020 - Dec 2022
Educative
Software Engineer	Jun 2018 - Sep 2020
SKILLS
Python, Machine Learning, Data Analysis


JOB CONTEXT:
Job Description:
Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, bui...
Target Position: Product Manager II, Applied AI at Uber (Uber Eats)Role Level: Mid
Key Requirements:- Required Skills: Product management from discovery through launch, Applied AI/ML product development, Translating AI/ML capabilities into intuitive, user-centric experiences, Strong analytical and data-driven decision making, Roadmapping and prioritization, Cross-functional collaboration with engineering, data science, design, and operations, Defining product requirements from user research, feedback, and data, Impact measurement and iterative improvement, Clear written and verbal communication to technical and non-technical audiences, Balancing technical feasibility, user value, and business impact- Keywords: Product Manager II, Applied AI, Uber Eats, Product Management, AI/ML, Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLM, Conversational AI, Recommendations

Think step-by-step:
1. Scan for repetitive/duplicate bullet points (critical check)
2. Check ATS compatibility (formatting, structure)
3. Count keyword matches from provided requirements
4. Evaluate content quality and professionalism
5. Calculate keyword coverage score
6. Determine if any critical failure conditions exist

Return only valid JSON in the following format:
{
    "is_valid": true,
    "keyword_coverage_score": 85,
    "issues_found": ["issue1", "issue2"],
    "suggestions": ["suggestion1", "suggestion2"],
    "feedback_for_rewrite": "Specific feedback for improvements"
}

Example output:
{
    "is_valid": false,
    "keyword_coverage_score": 45,
    "issues_found": ["Repetitive bullet points in experience section", "Low keyword coverage", "Missing email address"],
    "suggestions": ["Add keywords: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD", "Use past tense for previous roles"],
    "feedback_for_rewrite": "Resume needs stronger alignment with DevOps keywords. Add more technical skills and quantifiable achievements."
}

Validation criteria for is_valid determination:
CRITICAL FAILURES (any of these = is_valid false):
- Repetitive or duplicate bullet points across resume
- keyword_coverage_score < 60%
- Major grammar/spelling errors
- Missing email address (phone is optional)

Additional quality checks:
- ATS compatibility (no headers/footers, tables, graphics)
- Standard sections present (contact, experience, education)
- Consistent verb tenses throughout
- Quantifiable achievements included

Scoring: keyword_coverage_score = (matched_keywords / total_required_keywords) * 100

- If job provided: keyword coverage >= 60% for is_valid = true
- If no job: general quality check for is_valid = true

Do not include any text outside the JSON structure.", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "human", "name": null, "id": null, "example": false}]]

{"job_description": "Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.", "job_metadata": {"title": "Product Manager II, Applied AI", "company": "Uber (Uber Eats)", "role_level": "Mid", "sponsorship": "Not Specified", "posted_date": null, "posted_date_raw": "", "job_type": "Full-time", "job_url": ""}, "resume_content": "﻿Leaficient        Pittsburgh, PA Machine Learning Engineer        Apr 2024 - Present
*  Designed and deployed ML models for image understanding with PyTorch, leveraging vision-language models and image generation to improve segmentation accuracy by 20%. 
* Implemented 3D computer vision models in PyTorch for geometry from monocular images, reducing prediction error by 8%. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, and inference latency to optimize deployment.
* Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
* Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
* Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.


Educative        Lahore, Pakistan Technical Product Manager        Oct 2020 - Dec 2022 
* Led development of ML-powered recommendation and ranking system serving 1.5M+ users, collaborating with engineers to design hybrid algorithms that improved CTR by 10%. 
* Performed A/B testing, offline evaluation, and iterative model refinement to balance recommendation quality with system latency. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.
* Educative Software Engineer        Jun 2018 - Sep 2020 
* Rebuilt backend search & discovery pipeline from basic text-matching to Google’s search infrastructure, enriching results with metadata and improving relevance. Original Job Description:
Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" p

Resume Content:
﻿Leaficient        Pittsburgh, PA Machine Learning Engineer        Apr 2024 - Present
*  Designed and deployed ML models for image understanding with PyTorch, leveraging vision-language models and image generation to improve segmentation accuracy by 20%. 
* Implemented 3D computer vision models in PyTorch for geometry from monocular images, reducing prediction error by 8%. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, and inference latency to optimize deployment.
* Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
* Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
* Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.


Educative        Lahore, Pakistan Technical Product Manager        Oct 2020 - Dec 2022 
* Led development of ML-powered recommendation and ranking system serving 1.5M+ users, collaborating with engineers to design hybrid algorithms that improved CTR by 10%. 
* Performed A/B testing, offline evaluation, and iterative model refinement to balance recommendation quality with system latency. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.
* Educative Software Engineer        Jun 2018 - Sep 2020 
* Rebuilt backend search & discovery pipeline from basic text-matching to Google’s search infrastructure, enriching results with metadata and improving relevance. Reduced page drop-off by 40%, driving higher content discovery and user retention.

About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

[[{"content": "You are the final validator in a multi-agent resume optimization system.

Your role: Validate the complete resume document using requirements from the JD Analyzer.

Critical failure conditions that MUST result in is_valid=false:
- Repetitive or duplicate bullet points (same content repeated)
- Keyword coverage below 60%
- Major grammar/spelling errors
- Missing critical sections (email contact, experience, education)

Evaluate for:
1. Content Quality - NO repetitive bullets, grammar, consistency
2. ATS Compatibility - simple formatting, standard sections
3. Keyword Coverage - using keywords identified by JD Analyzer (consider synonyms and partial matches)
4. Job Alignment - relevance to target position

Only be strict with repetitve content if it is too repetitive or there are exact duplicates.", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "system", "name": null, "id": null}, {"content": "Validate this resume:

RESUME CONTENT:

shayan.ali.work@gmail.com •  linkedin.com/in/ali-shayan

Leaficient	Pittsburgh, PA

SKILLS
Python, Machine Learning, Data Analysis


JOB CONTEXT:
Job Description:
Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, bui...
Target Position: Product Manager II, Applied AI at Uber (Uber Eats)Role Level: Mid
Key Requirements:- Required Skills: Product management from discovery through launch, Applied AI/ML product development, Translating AI/ML capabilities into intuitive, user-centric experiences, Strong analytical and data-driven decision making, Roadmapping and prioritization, Cross-functional collaboration with engineering, data science, design, and operations, Defining product requirements from user research, feedback, and data, Impact measurement and iterative improvement, Clear written and verbal communication to technical and non-technical audiences, Balancing technical feasibility, user value, and business impact- Keywords: Product Manager II, Applied AI, Uber Eats, Product Management, AI/ML, Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLM, Conversational AI, Recommendations

Think step-by-step:
1. Scan for repetitive/duplicate bullet points (critical check)
2. Check ATS compatibility (formatting, structure)
3. Count keyword matches from provided requirements
4. Evaluate content quality and professionalism
5. Calculate keyword coverage score
6. Determine if any critical failure conditions exist

Return only valid JSON in the following format:
{
    "is_valid": true,
    "keyword_coverage_score": 85,
    "issues_found": ["issue1", "issue2"],
    "suggestions": ["suggestion1", "suggestion2"],
    "feedback_for_rewrite": "Specific feedback for improvements"
}

Example output:
{
    "is_valid": false,
    "keyword_coverage_score": 45,
    "issues_found": ["Repetitive bullet points in experience section", "Low keyword coverage", "Missing email address"],
    "suggestions": ["Add keywords: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD", "Use past tense for previous roles"],
    "feedback_for_rewrite": "Resume needs stronger alignment with DevOps keywords. Add more technical skills and quantifiable achievements."
}

Validation criteria for is_valid determination:
CRITICAL FAILURES (any of these = is_valid false):
- Repetitive or duplicate bullet points across resume
- keyword_coverage_score < 60%
- Major grammar/spelling errors
- Missing email address (phone is optional)

Additional quality checks:
- ATS compatibility (no headers/footers, tables, graphics)
- Standard sections present (contact, experience, education)
- Consistent verb tenses throughout
- Quantifiable achievements included

Scoring: keyword_coverage_score = (matched_keywords / total_required_keywords) * 100

- If job provided: keyword coverage >= 60% for is_valid = true
- If no job: general quality check for is_valid = true

Do not include any text outside the JSON structure.", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "human", "name": null, "id": null, "example": false}]]

{"job_description": "Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. * Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
* Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
* Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.

Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.

Original Job Description:
Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" p

Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. * Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023

* Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.

{"job_description": "Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.
Balance innovation with execution by making informed tradeoffs across technical feasibility, user value, and business impact.
Measure impact and iterate, using data-driven analysis to improve product performance and inform future investments.
Clearly communicate product plans, strategy, and results to stakeholders across technical and non-technical functions, including senior leadership.
Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.
Preferred Qualifications

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For Sunnyvale, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$161,000 per year - USD$179,000 per year.

For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

Uber's mission is to reimagine the way the world moves for the better. Here, bold ideas create real-world impact, challenges drive growth, and speed fuels progress. What moves us, moves the world - let's move it forward, together.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.", "job_metadata": {"title": "Product Manager II, Applied AI", "company": "Uber (Uber Eats)", "role_level": "Mid", "sponsorship": "Not Specified", "posted_date": null, "posted_date_raw": "", "job_type": "Full-time", "job_url": ""}, "resume_content": "﻿Leaficient        Pittsburgh, PA Machine Learning Engineer        Apr 2024 - Present
*  Designed and deployed ML models for image understanding with PyTorch, leveraging vision-language models and image generation to improve segmentation accuracy by 20%. 
* Implemented 3D computer vision models in PyTorch for geometry from monocular images, reducing prediction error by 8%. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, and inference latency to optimize deployment.
* Built data augmentation pipeline using PyTorch and scikit-learn, generating synthetic training variants that improved model recall by 50% in production. Addressed distribution shift and data scarcity through systematic augmentation strategies. 
* Established ML engineering best practices by containerizing (Docker, AWS EKS), achieving 30% latency reduction. Built robust systems supporting reproducible experimentation and rapid iteration without compromising quality.


Department of Human Services        Pittsburgh PA Data Scientist Intern        Jun 2023 - Aug 2023
* Developed ranking and recommendation system for resource allocation across 100k+ high-dimensional individuals. Implemented learning-to-rank models that improved NDCG@K by 8% over baseline, optimizing model performance through feature engineering and hyperparameter tuning. 
* Built interpretable ML models achieving 20% AUC improvement. Evaluated fairness metrics using statistical analysis and visualization, explaining model decisions to non-technical stakeholders to ensure adoption.


Educative        Lahore, Pakistan Technical Product Manager        Oct 2020 - Dec 2022 
* Led development of ML-powered recommendation and ranking system serving 1.5M+ users, collaborating with engineers to design hybrid algorithms that improved CTR by 10%. 
* Performed A/B testing, offline evaluation, and iterative model refinement to balance recommendation quality with system latency. Evaluated technical tradeoffs between model complexity, serving latency, and recommendation quality. Iterated rapidly on ranking features and model architectures without compromising production stability.
* Educative Software Engineer        Jun 2018 - Sep 2020 
* Rebuilt backend search & discovery pipeline from basic text-matching to Google’s search infrastructure, enriching results with metadata and improving relevance. JOB CONTEXT:
Job Description:
Product Manager II, Applied AI
Product Management, Product
San Francisco, California   |   Sunnyvale, California
Apply Now
About the Role

Uber Eats is transforming the way local businesses operate, grow, and connect with their customers. Merchants are at the heart of our ecosystem, and we are building the next generation of AI-powered capabilities and solutions to help them seamlessly run and scale their businesses.

As a Product Manager on the Applied AI team, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering AI-driven products that empower merchants with insights, recommendations, automation, and support. You will partner closely with engineering, data science, design, and operations teams to ensure we’re applying cutting-edge AI technologies in practical ways that solve real merchant problems. This is a highly cross-functional role where you will drive both strategy and execution, bringing together user needs, technical capabilities, and business goals.

What the Candidate Will Do

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.
Partner with AI/ML engineers and data scientists to design and ship solutions that leverage advanced ML and Generative AI, from conversational experience to intelligent recommendations
Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, bui...
Target Position: Product Manager II, Applied AI at Uber (Uber Eats)Role Level: Mid
Key Requirements:- Required Skills: Product management from discovery through launch, Applied AI/ML product development, Translating AI/ML capabilities into intuitive, user-centric experiences, Strong analytical and data-driven decision making, Roadmapping and prioritization, Cross-functional collaboration with engineering, data science, design, and operations, Defining product requirements from user research, feedback, and data, Impact measurement and iterative improvement, Clear written and verbal communication to technical and non-technical audiences, Balancing technical feasibility, user value, and business impact- Keywords: Product Manager II, Applied AI, Uber Eats, Product Management, AI/ML, Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLM, Conversational AI, Recommendations

Think step-by-step:
1. Scan for repetitive/duplicate bullet points (critical check)
2. Check ATS compatibility (formatting, structure)
3. Count keyword matches from provided requirements
4. Evaluate content quality and professionalism
5. Calculate keyword coverage score
6. Determine if any critical failure conditions exist

Return only valid JSON in the following format:
{
    "is_valid": true,
    "keyword_coverage_score": 85,
    "issues_found": ["issue1", "issue2"],
    "suggestions": ["suggestion1", "suggestion2"],
    "feedback_for_rewrite": "Specific feedback for improvements"
}

Example output:
{
    "is_valid": false,
    "keyword_coverage_score": 45,
    "issues_found": ["Repetitive bullet points in experience section", "Low keyword coverage", "Missing email address"],
    "suggestions": ["Add keywords: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD", "Use past tense for previous roles"],
    "feedback_for_rewrite": "Resume needs stronger alignment with DevOps keywords. Add more technical skills and quantifiable achievements."
}

Validation criteria for is_valid determination:
CRITICAL FAILURES (any of these = is_valid false):
- Repetitive or duplicate bullet points across resume
- keyword_coverage_score < 60%
- Major grammar/spelling errors
- Missing email address (phone is optional)

Additional quality checks:
- ATS compatibility (no headers/footers, tables, graphics)
- Standard sections present (contact, experience, education)
- Consistent verb tenses throughout
- Quantifiable achievements included

Scoring: keyword_coverage_score = (matched_keywords / total_required_keywords) * 100

- If job provided: keyword coverage >= 60% for is_valid = true
- If no job: general quality check for is_valid = true

Do not include any text outside the JSON structure.", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "human", "name": null, "id": null, "example": false}]]

Define and deliver AI capabilities that improve merchant operations, growth, and overall experience on Uber Eats.

Deeply understand merchant needs, turning insights from user research, feedback, and data into product requirements and roadmaps.
Establish a shared vision across Applied AI and Merchant Product, building consensus on priorities and driving alignment.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related technical/analytical field.
3+ years of product management experience, including delivering successful and innovative AI/ML products.
Experience working with applied AI/ML systems and translating technical solutions into intuitive, user-centric products and experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with comfort working in fast-paced, ambiguous environments.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, from ideation to launch.

MBA or Master’s degree in a technical or analytical field.
Experience building AI/ML-powered products ideally in commerce or marketplaces
Familiarity with emerging Generative AI technologies and their applications to business workflows and user experiences
Strong customer empathy, with experience conducting B2B or SMB-focused research and translating insights into solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of influencing across organizational boundaries.
A "driver" personality- constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery, while balancing the need for great collaboration.
